column1: First Name/Last Name,"How familiar are you with Cloud providers tools?","How familiar are you with Docker?","How familiar are you with Terraform?","How many States you need to describe the provided case study?","How many Transitions needed between the states?","What are the types of events you need to describe in the case study?","How many VM instances needed to handle the application workload  during the high peak phase?","How many transitions led to the final state?","How intuitive do you think the Cloud Resource concept","How intuitive do you think the  Group concept?","How intuitive do you think the Resource Requirements concept?","How intuitive do you think the Constraint concept?","How intuitive do you think the State concept","How intuitive do you think the Events concept (e.g Temporal events, Resource usage events, QoS events, Market related events, User action events, Composite Event?","How intuitive do you think the  Reconfiguration Action concept?","Do you think the cEDM Core tool is useful for your day-to-day tasks?","What the points you don't like in the cEDM Core tool?","How would you improve the cEDM Core tool?"

*****,"5","5","5","4","7","resource related events(Q-event) and temporal events","14","3","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","","interesting and the idea of state machine is very original but I'm still curious how you intend to support the proactive elasticity "

******,"5","5","5","4","7","Q-event, TS-event/TP-event","14","3","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","there no support for optimization of used resources","support the proactive mode of cloud elasticity and integrate optimization algos "

******,"5","5","5","4","7","Q-event, TS-event, TP-event","14","3","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","the provided features are interesting","supporting proactive elasticity: I'am not sure that this tool with the provided model (despite its importance) is able to support "

******,"5","5","5","4","7","Q-event,TP-event-TS-event","14","3","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","5","","the system consists of solid and efficient technologies make it very powerful, as DevOps engineer (scripting, coding and deploying IaaS resources) I never imagined that the elasticity could be simplified like this, really I was impressed by the idea of using just state machine to abstract and to conceal all technical details related to elasticity. But it should be noted that such state machine has to be valid before launching its deployment, that is ensure that the choice of thresholds are perfect, absence of conflicts between the elasticity actions, elasticity behaviour encapsulated using the state machine should be verified in some way at design time "
